availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Barnett (Marion County and Green County Attorney; Commonwealth's Attorney)

body.p: Kentucky attorney. Kentucky native. Son of William Barnett Married to Francis Katherine "Kate" Tyler Barnett in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky on December 11, 1856. Father of William P. T. Barnett and Tyler Barnett. Attended Georgetown College in Scott County, Kentucky. Attended Harvard University in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Graduated from the University of Louisville Law School in Louisville in 1848. Attorney in Green County in 1850. Household owned thirty-two enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Served as the Commonwealth's Attorney for the 5th Kentucky Judicial District from 1858 to 1861. Attorney in Marion County in 1860. Member of the Democratic Party.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 125A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 215.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000819605.
The National Almanac and Annual Record for the Year 1863 (Philadephia: George W. Childs, 1863), 460.
